title: Group-Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) -- From Scratch
description: How DeepSeek eliminated the critic network and made RLHF simpler, cheaper, and better. From group-relative advantages to training reasoning models.

notebooks.title: Understanding GRPO: From PPO to Group-Relative Advantages
notebooks.objective: Understand why PPO needs a critic, build the core intuition behind group-relative advantages, and implement advantage computation from scratch.

notebooks.title: Implementing the GRPO Loss Function
notebooks.objective: Build the three components of the GRPO loss (clipped surrogate, group-relative advantages, KL penalty) from scratch and verify with numerical examples.

notebooks.title: Training a Reasoning Model with GRPO
notebooks.objective: Train a tiny transformer to solve arithmetic using GRPO with binary verifiable rewards -- the same approach DeepSeek used for R1.

caseStudy.title: Automated Financial Report Reasoning with GRPO
caseStudy.subtitle: Training Verifiable AI Analysts at QuantaLedger Analytics
caseStudy.description: QuantaLedger's AI-powered financial Q&A system achieves 91% on lookup queries but only 43% on multi-step reasoning. GRPO with verifiable rewards improves reasoning accuracy to 75%+ without requiring a reward model or critic network, saving 42% on infrastructure costs.

curator.name: Dr. Rajat Dandekar
curator.title: Course Instructor
curator.bio: Dr. Rajat Dandekar is a researcher and educator specializing in AI/ML, with a passion for making complex concepts accessible through intuitive explanations and hands-on learning.
